comments:
R3.1 M6.  Trying to open the default TextEditor from an action:

 ... 
 IWorkbenchPage page = PlatformUI.getWorkbench()
                       .getActiveWorkbenchWindow().getActivePage();
 try
  {
   page.openEditor(someIStorageEditorInput,
                   "org.eclipse.ui.DefaultTextEditor");
  }
 catch (PartInitException x) // couldn't init editor with id specified above
  {
   . . .
  }

fails in ui.internal.PartTester.testWorkbenchPart(IWorkbenchPart part):

 // Test getTitleToolTip
 Assert.isNotNull(part.getTitleToolTip());

It worked OK in R3.1 M5a.  Here's the log:

IWorkbenchPart.getTitleToolTip() is spec'ed that it must not return null, and
has been since at least 3.0.

This is a bug in the editor with ID org.eclipse.ui.DefaultTextEditor

Moving to text.

Doug, EditorPart.getToolTipText() returns the title tool tip of the editor input.

I did a quick check over the exisiting editor inputs and they seem fine. You
need to tell me the concrete class of 'someIStorageEditorInput'.
Doug, any more info on this one?

>>> You need to tell me the concrete class of 'someIStorageEditorInput'

OK, I see.  My custom implementation of IStorageEditorInput was returning null
in its getToolTipText().  I changed it to return a regular string and it solved
the problem.

Sorry for this 'user-error' alarm.  It's just that the code's always been like
that, and only started to fail in M6.
